summary: Email chain from Mark Steward of the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) to an unnamed US prosecutor's office (likely SDNY) inquiring about the status of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his relationship with JP Morgan's private wealth division. The FCA seeks to coordinate on the matter.

persons.name: Mark Steward
persons.role: Executive Director of Enforcement and Market Oversight at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
persons.context: Author of the email inquiry, seeking information about the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and JP Morgan.

persons.name: Kate Tuckley
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation inquiry.

persons.name: Kelly Eldred
persons.role: Personal Assistant to Mark Steward at the FCA
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation inquiry.

persons.name: Harry Caldecott
persons.role: Private Secretary to Mark Steward at the FCA
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation inquiry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of an ongoing investigation, specifically regarding his relationship with JP Morgan's private wealth division.

connections.description: Steward, representing the UK FCA, is inquiring about the investigation into Epstein's financial activities.
Eldred is identified as Steward's Personal Assistant.
Caldecott is identified as Steward's Private Secretary.

events.title: FCA inquiry into Epstein investigation
events.description: Mark Steward of the UK Financial Conduct Authority sends an urgent email to a US prosecutor's office (likely SDNY) asking if they are handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, particularly regarding JP Morgan.

locations: 12 Endeavour Square, London E20 1JN, United Kingdom (FCA registered office)
keyFacts: The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) was actively seeking information about the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in November 2019.
The FCA's inquiry specifically mentioned Epstein's relationship with JP Morgan's private wealth division as a client.
The email was directed to a US prosecutor's office, implied to be the Southern District of New York (SDNY), suggesting international coordination on the Epstein case.
The communication is marked 'Confidential & Urgent', indicating the sensitivity and priority of the matter for the UK regulator.
